subject: Re: how to run a subset of methods annoted with test?
msgSnippet: To give more details... I can run a required set of tests by creating a arry of of tests . Request testSuite = Request.classes(suiteDescription, testList);
messageBody:
To give more details...

I can run a required set of tests by creating a arry of of tests .

Request testSuite = Request.classes(suiteDescription, testList);
JUnitCore core = new JUnitCore();
core.run(testSuite);


Say my testList has 5 diff tests TestClass1..... TestClass5. Each of this TestClass has 10 tests methods.
In each of these TestClasses I would like to run only the selected test methods and skip the rest of the methods.


Request.method(class, methodname)
Solves my purpose if I have a single TestClass.

How to achieve this for an array of testclasses

Thanks
Shubha



 


----- Original Message ----
From: Shubha B S <mailtoshubha@...>
To: Junit forum <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, 16 October, 2008 11:37:19 AM
Subject: how to run a subset of methods annoted with test?


Hi,

Is it possible to run only a set of testmethods (subset of methods annoted by test) using Junit 4.1?

Thanks
Shubha
